content.webTitle: Airbus could plough 7bn into upgrading new plane

fields.headline: Airbus could plough 7bn into upgrading new plane
fields.bodyText: European aerospace group EADS, majority owner of plane-maker Airbus, is planning upgrades to the firm's new A350 plane to catch up with rival Boeing's 787 Dreamliner. Announcing a 19% jump in first-quarter pre-tax profits to 780m euros (£530m), Noel Forgeard, EADS co-chief executive, said changes would be in line with Airbus's "financing capacity". Airbus could spend up to 7bn euros on a new A350, depending on the outcome of talks to buy out the 20% stake in Airbus owned by Britain's BAE. EADS values BAE's stake at 3.5bn euros, but the British firm wants an "astronomic" price, EADS said.
